pages.text: $(li)The Water Bucket contains Water in its interior.$(br)$(li)Right click while you are pointing to a Lava block and you are holding a $(l:patchouli:tools/vanilla/bucket)Empty Bucket$(/l) in your hand to obtain it.

$(li)You can release the interior of the Water Bucket, just right click pointing in the specific block where do you want to release it while you are holding the Water Bucket on your hand.$(br)$(li)The Water will be evaporate instantly in the Nether.$(br)$(li)$(l:patchouli:creatures/vanilla/enderman)Endermen$(/l) really hate this liquid, you can take advantage of this against these creatures.

$(li)You can use it to craft Corrocks, Rusty Iron Plates or $(l:patchouli:miscellaneous/environmental/mud_ball)Mud Balls$(/l) in a $(l:patchouli:utility/vanilla/crafting_table)$(l:patchouli:utility/vanilla/crafting_table)Crafting Table$(/l)$(/l).$(br)$(li)A lot of aquatic creatures can be saved inside of a Water bucket.$(br)$(li)To do this you need hold the Water Bucket on your hand and right click the creature to save it in its interior.$(br)$(li)Then you can release it following the same process.
